sen.j: 牟義都国造（むげつのくにのみやつこ・むげつこくぞう）は美濃国北中部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Musashinokuninomiyatsuko 牟義都国造 (also known as Mugetsukokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the central part of Mino Province.
Musashi no kuninomiyatsuko 牟義都国造 (also known as Mugetsukokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the central part of Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Musashi no kuninomiyatsuko 牟義都国造 (also known as Mugetsukokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the central part of Mino Province.

sen.j: 牟宜都国造・身毛津国造などとも。
sen.e: It was also written as 牟宜都国造 and 身毛津国造.
It was also written as 牟宜都国造 or 身毛津国造.
It was also written as 牟宜都国造 or 身毛津国造.

sen.j: 『古事記』によると、景行天皇の子の大碓命が大根王の娘の弟媛と密通して誕生した押黒弟日子王が祖という。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki", Oousunomikoto, a son of Emperor Keiko, made an illicit love to Otohime, a daughter of Oonenomiko, and had a son Oshigurootohikonomiko, who was the ancestor of the clan.
According to "Kojiki," Oousu no mikoto, a son of Emperor Keiko, made an illicit love to Otohime, a daughter of Oone no miko, and had a son Oshigurootohiko no miko, who was the ancestor of the clan.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を調整表記変更
sen.e: According to "Kojiki," Oousu no mikoto, a son of Emperor Keiko, made an illicit love to Otohime, a daughter of Oone no miko, and had a son Oshigurootohiko no miko, who was the ancestor of the clan.

sen.j: 継体天皇の祖父も同国造の娘を娶ったという。
sen.e: It is also said that a grandfather of Emperor Keitai married a daughter of Mugetsunokuninomiyatsuko.
It is also said that a grandfather of Emperor Keitai married a daughter of Mugetsu no kuninomiyatsuko.
It is also said that a grandfather of Emperor Keitai married a daughter of Mugetsu no kuninomiyatsuko.

sen.j: 身毛氏 ...... 牟下・牟下都・牟下津・牟宜都・牟義・武義・牟宜津氏などとも。
sen.e: The Muge 身毛 clan: It is also written as 牟下, 牟下都, 牟下津, 牟宜都, 牟義, 武義, and 牟宜津.
The Muge 身毛 clan: It is also written as 牟下, 牟下都, 牟下津, 牟宜都, 牟義, 武義, and 牟宜津.

sen.j: 後に宿禰を賜るものもいた。
sen.e: Some descendants were conferred on Sukune.

sen.j: 鴨県主の姻族で、同氏に代わって美泉を大王に献上する儀式を担当したという。
sen.e: The clan became a relative of Kamoagatanushi by marriage and took over the role of presenting wonder-working fountain to Ookimi.
The clan became a relative of Kamoagatanushi by marriage and took over the role of presenting wonder-working fountain to Ookimi.

sen.j: 身毛大夫 ...... 古墳時代の豪族。
sen.e: Mugetsu no Masurao: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.
